deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2065-08-02
Vascular Surgery Admission Note
Patient Name: Quick, Isabelle
MRN: 6557545
Date and Time: 8/02/65 2:40PM
Attending: Dr. Iyer
Fellow: Dr. Wade
Junior Resident: Dr. Joyce
cc: thrombosed R fem-pop BPG; increasing rest pain in R leg
HPI: The patient is a 53 year old woman with a past medical history of diabetes, HTN, and PVD s/p L fem-pop BPG with in-situ vein 2063, R fem to AK pop BPG with GSV 2063, R fem-BK pop BPG with propatent graft 9/17/64, and multiple attempts at angiographic intervention who presents with worsening rest pain in the R leg X 1 month.
Immediately following her 2nd R fem-pop BPG in 9/2064, she felt well and without significant LE pain. Over the past month, however, the patient reports that she has had progressive pain in her R foot and leg, which wakes her up from sleep almost every night. She can walk less than one block without disabling claudication which improves with rest. She also has noticed discoloration of her R foot, along with numbness and paresthesias, which have been progressive over the same time period.
She denies all symptoms other than RLE pain and claudication as described. Specifically, she denies chest pain, shortness of breath, dizziness, headache, and fevers/chills. She reports that her left leg is occasionally painful, although it has been tolerable in comparison to her R leg. She has been taking aspirin and plavix regularly, but has not taken coumadin for 2 days (last dose 7/31/65).
She last underwent arterial LENIs on 7/17/65, which demonstrated critical ischemia in her R leg and a thrombosed R fem-pop BPG (see below for official report). She is admitted for elective revascularization of her R leg.
PMH:
DM II
HTN
PVD
Hyperlipidemia
Chronic Pancreatitis
PSH:
9/20/64: angio/PTA L proximal fem-pop bpg and L SFA
9/17/64: R CFA endarterectomy; R fem-BK pop BPG w/ propatent graft
10/2063, angio w/ BLE runoff
4/2063: R CFA and EIA endarterectomy; R fem-pop BPG to AK pop using transposed greater saphenous veins
1/2063: L iliofemoral endarterectomy with PTA & in situ vein AK L fem-pop bpg
2061: Whipple procedure for chronic pancreatitis
Meds:
1. Acetylsalicylic Acid (Aspirin) 325 MG PO
2. Atenolol 50 MG PO QD
3. Clopidogrel (Plavix) 75 MG PO QD
4. Cyproheptadine Hcl 4 MG PO BID
5. Glipizide 2.5 MG PO QD
6. Metformin 500 MG PO TID
7. Multivitamins 1 TAB PO QD
8. Pantoprazole (Protonix) 40 MG PO QD
9. Pioglitazone (Actos) 30 MG PO QD
10. Simvastatin 20 MG PO QD
11. Warfarin Sodium (Coumadin) 5 MG PO QD
ALL: NKDA
Social:
Previous smoker, quit approximately 3 years ago
Denies EtOH
ROS: as above; otherwise negative with exception of presenting complaints
PE:
VS: T 98.2 HR 80 BP 129/65 RR 18 96% RA
NAD, comfortable-appearing middle-aged woman, NAD
Neck: no bruits appreciated
CV: RRR, no m/r/g
Pulm: CTA bilaterally, no wheezes or crackles
Abd: soft, non tender, non distended; R vertical paramedian scar, well-healed
Ext:
LLE warm, with well healed femoral and L knee incisions, normal color and sensation
R foot cool, with small amount of discoloration present distal to mid-metatarsals; sensation grossly intact although subjectively less than L foot
Pulses:
Rad Fem Pop DP PT
R 2+ 1+ NP weak Doppler signal no doppler signal
L 2+ 2+ NP strong Doppler signal + Doppler signal
PVRs demonstrate pulsatile signals in LLE; waveforms are flat in RLE
EKG: normal sinus rhythm, no ischemic changes
Labs:
Plasma Sodium 139 (135-145) mmol/L
Plasma Potassium 4.9 H (3.4-4.8) mmol/L
Plasma Chloride 101 (100-108) mmol/L
Plasma Carbon Dioxide 28.7 (23.0-31.9) mmol/L
Plasma Anion GAP 9 (3-15) mmol/L
Phosphorus 3.7 (2.6-4.5) mg/dl
Magnesium 1.6 (1.4-2.0) meq/L
Plasma Urea Nitrogen 9 (8-25) mg/dl
Plasma Creatinine 0.94 (0.60-1.50) mg/dl
eGFR >60 mL/min/1.73m2
Plasma Glucose 289 H (70-110) mg/dl
WBC 8.1 (4.5-11.0) th/cmm
HCT 39.3 (36.0-46.0) %
HGB 13.8 (12.0-16.0) gm/dl
RBC 4.31 (4.00-5.20) mil/cmm
PLT 281 (150-400) th/cumm
MCV 91 (80-100) fl
MCH 31.9 (26.0-34.0) pg/rbc
MCHC 35.0 (31.0-37.0) g/dl
RDW 15.6 H (11.5-14.5) %
PT 15.8 H (10.3-13.2) sec
PT-INR 1.4
APTT 28.3 (22.1-34.0) sec
UA-Color Yellow (YELLOW)
UA-Turbidity Clear (CLEAR)
UA-Glucose 2+ (NEG)
UA-Bili NEGATIVE (NEG)
UA-Ketones NEGATIVE (NEG)
UA-Specific Gravity 1.005 (1.001-1.035)
UA-Occult Blood NEGATIVE (NEG)
UA-pH 5.0 (5.0-9.0)
UA-Albumin NEGATIVE (NEG)
UA-Urobilinogen NEGATIVE (NEG)
UA-Nitrite NEGATIVE (NEG)
UA-WBC Screen NEGATIVE (NEG)
Imaging:
CXR 8/02: clear lungs
Arterial LENI (7/17/65):
1. Critical peripheral arterial disease in the right leg at rest.
2. Disease is located in the aorto-iliac, femoral and popliteal segments on the right side.
3. Mild peripheral arterial disease in the left leg at rest.
4. Disease is located in the aorto-iliac and tibial/peroneal segments on the left side.
5. There has been a significant drop in the ankle/brachial index in the right leg since the last exam, from 0.77 to 0.26.
6. Occlusion of the right femoral to popliteal PTFE bypass graft.
Assessment:
The patient is a 53 year old woman with a past medical history of diabetes, HTN, and PVD s/p L fem-pop BPG with in-situ vein 2063, R fem to AK pop BPG with GSV 2063, R fem-BK pop BPG with propatent graft 9/17/64, and multiple attempts at angiographic intervention who presents with worsening rest pain in the R leg X 1 month.
Given her progressive pain, worsening PVRs, and thrombosed BPG, she will go to the OR 8/03 for fem-pop thrombectomy, possible fem-fem bypass graft, and angiogram with possible angioplasty/stent.
Plan:
-Admit to Vascular Surgery, attending Dr. Iyer
-Labs, EKG, CXR
-Hold Coumadin, continue aspirin/plavix, begin heparin drip at 500 Units/hr, with sliding scale and target PTT 40-60
-Hold heparin drip on call to OR
-NPO p midnight, IV fluids
-Consent obtained and placed in chart
Case discussed with Dr. David Wade, Vascular Fellow
Francis D. Link
ATCH Surgery
Pager 40232
